required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on October 07, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of a Face Mask on Oxygenation During Exercise
clinical_study.official_title: The Effects of Wearing a Face Mask During COVID-19 on Blood and Muscle Oxygenation While Performing Exercise

brief_summary.textblock: There is concern that wearing a face mask during COVID will affect oxygen uptake, especially during intense exercise. This study will assess the effect of wearing two different face masks (disposable and cloth) on blood and muscle oxygenation during cycling exercise.

detailed_description.textblock: There is concern that wearing a face mask during exercise will reduce oxygen uptake or increase carbon dioxide re-breathing, which can result in low blood oxygen levels, reduced oxygen delivery to muscle and reduced exercise capacity. The purpose of the study is to determine the effect of wearing two different types of commonly-worn face masks (diposable and cloth) during exercise on blood and muscle oxygenation. Twelve participants who are experienced with cycling will take part in this randomized cross-over study that will assess blood oxygenation (i.e. pulse oximetry) and muscle oxygenation (with near infrared spectroscopy) during a progressive step exercise test to exhaustion. The conditions include no mask, a disposable mask, and a cloth mask. Outcome variables include exercise duration, rating of perceived exertion, blood oxygen saturation levels, and oxygenated, deoxygenated, and total hemoglobin at the quadriceps muscle.

study_design_info.masking_description: The individual who will statistically analyze the data will be blinded to condition

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in blood oxygen saturation
secondary_outcome.description: Blood oxygen saturation as determined by pulse oximetry

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in quadriceps oxygenated hemoglobin
secondary_outcome.description: Oxygenated hemoglobin as measured by near infra-red spectroscopy

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in quadriceps de-oxygenated hemoglobin
secondary_outcome.description: De-oxygenated hemoglobin as measured by near infra-red spectroscopy

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in quadriceps total hemoglobin
secondary_outcome.description: Total hemoglobin as measured by near infra-red spectroscopy

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in rating of perceived exertion
secondary_outcome.description: Rating of perceived exertion on a scale of 1-10 (Modified Borg Scale)

arm_group.description: Progressive step-exercise cycling test to exhaustion wearing no face mask
Progressive step-exercise cycling test to exhaustion wearing a 3-ply disposable face mask
Progressive step-exercise cycling test to exhaustion wearing a cloth face mask

intervention.intervention_name: Progressive cycling exercise test to exhaustion
intervention.description: Progressive step cycling exercise test to exhaustion

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Experienced with cycling
Exclusion Criteria:
- Contra-indications to exercise as identified by a screening questionnaire (the "Get Active Questionnaire")
